intro: Serapias damasonium, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rockcress. It is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, linear leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with five petals. The plant is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, typically growing in dry, rocky habitats. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions. Serapias damasonium is adapted to arid environments and is known for its resilience to drought conditions.
